Class BoardAdapter

java.lang.Object
bridge.BoardAdapter
All Implemented Interfaces:
AIBoardAdapter
public final class BoardAdapter extends Object implements AIBoardAdapter
Adapter that exposes game.core.Board through AIBoardAdapter for AI agents. Lives in bridge to avoid a Game -> AI dependency.

    • BoardAdapter

      public BoardAdapter(Board board)
      Constructs an adapter for the given board.

      Initializes the internal integer matrix based on the board's current state. * @param board the Board instance to adapt

    • getMatrix

      public int[][] getMatrix()
      Returns the current board state as a 2D integer array.

      0 = Empty, 1 = Red, 2 = Black. * @return the integer matrix

    • getBoard

      public Board getBoard()
      Returns:
      the underlying Board instance

    • updateMatrix

      public void updateMatrix()
      Synchronizes the internal integer matrix to match the current state of the Board object.

    • updateBoard

      public void updateBoard()
      Synchronizes the underlying Board object to match the current state of the integer matrix.

      This rebuilds the board state and clears move history.

    • undoMove

      public void undoMove(int row, int col)
      Manually undoes a move at the specified coordinate.

      This sets the position to 0 in the matrix and refreshes the board state. * @param row the row coordinate

      Parameters:
      col - the column coordinate

    • isGameOver

      public boolean isGameOver()
      Checks if the game has reached a terminal state. * @return true if the game is over

    • getWinner

      public Player getWinner()
      Determines the winner of the game, if any. * @return Player.RED or Player.BLACK if there is a winner, null otherwise

    • reset

      public void reset()
      Resets both the matrix and the underlying board to an empty state.

    • colorToInt

      private int colorToInt(Color color)
      Converts a Color enum to its corresponding integer representation.

      RED = 1, BLACK = 2, EMPTY = 0.

      Parameters:

      Returns:
      the integer value
